model.cell

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.cell.Cell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICell

    public class Cell
extends java.util.Observable
implements ICell
    Cell class is for a minesweeper like game. The cell can either contain a bomb or the number of bombs surrounding the cell. The cell can be in four different states: Hidden Flagged Possible Revealed The select and flag methods vary depending on the state of the cell.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Steven Proctor

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(boolean isBomb)
        Cell Constructor. Accepts a boolean as a parameter indicating whether or not the cell contains a bomb. Sets the state of the cell as Hidden. The number of bombs surrounding the cell is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        isBomb - boolean indicating whether or not the cell contains a bomb

        void setState(ICellState state)
        Sets the current state of the cell
        Parameters:
        state - the new state the cell has entered

      • getState

        public ICellState getState()
        Returns the current state of the Cell: - Hidden: Cell is hidden - Revealed: Cell is revealed - Flagged: Cannot by selected, user believes the cell contains a bomb - Possible: Cannot be selected, user believes the cell MIGHT contain a bomb
        Specified by:
        getState in interface ICell
        Returns:
        the current state of the cell

      • setBombsNearby

        public void setBombsNearby(int bombsNearby)
        Set the number of bombs surrounding the cell. Bombs may be directly adjacent or diagonal to the cell. Should only be used once after the board is initialized.
        Specified by:
        setBombsNearby in interface ICell
        Parameters:
        bombsNearby - the number of bombs surrounding the cell

      • getBombsNearby

        public int getBombsNearby()
        Return the number of bombs surrounding the cell. Bombs may be directly adjacent or diagonal to the cell.
        Specified by:
        getBombsNearby in interface ICell
        Returns:
        the number of bombs surrounding the cell

      • select

        public void select()
        Select the cell and attempts to reveal its contents. Flagged and Possible cells cannot be revealed. Will notify any observers if a state change occurs.
        Specified by:
        select in interface ICell

      • flag

        public void flag()
        Toggle the flag on a cell. An hidden cell will be marked with a flag. A flagged cell will be marked with a question mark. A possible cell will return to a hidden state. Observers will be notified of any state changes.
        Specified by:
        flag in interface ICell

      • isBomb

        public boolean isBomb()
        Returns whether or not the cell contains a bomb.
        Specified by:
        isBomb in interface ICell
        Returns:
        true if the cell contains a bomb, otherwise false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string containing "B" if the cell contains a bomb. Otherwise returns the number of bombs surrounding the cell.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        "B" if cell is a bomb, otherwise the number of bombs surrounding the cell
